summary: This report describes the federal response to 2 high-profile cybersecurity incidents that affected the U.S. government. The Russian Foreign Intelligence Service hacked SolarWinds network management software, which is widely used in the U.S. government. Also, Chinese government affiliates likely exploited a vulnerability in the Microsoft Exchange Server, according to the White House. Federal agencies worked with each other and industry after these incidents. Agencies received...
title: Cybersecurity: Federal Response to SolarWinds and Microsoft Exchange Incidents
